Local proton dynamics in perovskite-type protonic conductors by spectral hole burning spectroscopy

publication_name.en: PHYSICAL REVIEW B CONDENSED MATTER AND MATERIALS PHYSICS 1 JULY 2001

paper_title.en: Migration of hydrogen ions in SrCeO3 studied by ERD analysis

description.en: The migration of hydrogen ions dissolved in SrCeO3 induced by an applied electric potential has been studied over the temperature range from 25 to 200 degrees C. It was found that the hydrogen ions migrated towards the cathode, and they were trapped there when the cathode material had a good ability to getter the hydrogen. The amounts of hydrogen retained in the cathode could be determined by the ERDA technique using a high-energy He-4 beam. In order to estimate the proton transport number, defined as the ratio of the protonic conductivity to the total electric conductivity, we measured the amount of hydrogen retained in the cathode as a function of electric charge number through the specimen. The protonic conductivity and the proton diffusion coefficient were evaluated using the proton transport number and proton concentration in the specimen. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Electronic band structures of beta-alumina-type superionic crystals

description.en: In order to determine the structures of the electronic energy band of beta-alumina-type superionic crystals, photoemission spectra have been measured systematically using a beam line with synchrotron radiation. The information of the valence bands was obtained from photoemission spectra as all beta-alumina-type superionic crystals are constructed from the 2p orbitals of oxygen. The structures of the electronic energy bands of beta-alumina-type superionic crystals near Gamma point were determined from the results obtained in this work and from previous results concerning reflection spectra. The energy bands from the inner shells of the components of these materials were also determined. (C) 1998 Elsevier Science BN. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Absorption spectra and electronic structure of PrBa2Cu3Oy

description.en: We present measurements of the optical transmission and reflection performed at room temperature in the range from 0.2 to 3.5 eV on highly oriented PrBa2Cu3Oy films for oxygen contents between y=6.3 and 6.9. The spectra are discussed in terms of the absorption coefficient, determined directly from the measured transmission and reflection spectra. Three optical absorptions are resolved. For the oxygen content y=6.3, the absorption spectrum shows a gap of 1.1 eV, in good correspondence with the charge transfer gap of 1.21 eV determined from the high temperature conductivity. This energy gap decreases with oxygen content, but still exists for the oxygen content y=6.9. The electronic structure of the PrBa2Cu3Oy system is discussed within a semiconductor model in which the excess oxygen acts as an acceptor. © 1998 American Institute of Physics.

paper_title.en: Hydrogen permeability in(CeO2)<sub>0.9</sub>(CaO)<sub>0.1</sub> at High Temperature
Electronic structure of ρ-type SrTiO3 by photoemission spectroscopy
AN ERDA STUDY ON PROTON MIGRATION INDUGES BY ELECTRIC POTENTIAL IN SrZrO38SrCeO3, AND BaGeO3 OXIDES easurements of Proton Transport Number and Proton Diffusivity
Photoemission Study on Proton Conductor p-Type SrTiO<sub>3</sub>

description.en: The electronic structure of Sc-doped p-type SrTiO3 has been studied by photoemission spectroscopy. Comparing the results with those of Nb-doped n-type SrTiO3, the Fermi level of p-type is shifted to the low binding energy. As Sc dopant increases, the top of the valence band is shifted to the low binding energy in accord with the rigid-band model. The Ti 3d component in the O 2p band of p-type SrTiO3 increases compared with that of the n-type one. It was also found that the satellite intensities of Ti core levels drastically increase. The covalency of p-type SrTiO3 increases by the doping of the Sc ions. The dopant concentration dependence shows that the covalency is strongest when the Sc concentration is 2 mol%. These facts suggest that the covalency is related to the protonic conduction. © 1998 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Fabrication of proton conducting thin films of SrZrO3 and SrCeO3 and their fundamental characterization

description.en: Proton conducting thin films of SrZrO3 and SrCeO3 were fabricated by the pulsed laser ablation method using ArF excimer laser. The thin films of SrCeO3 and SrZrO3 were grown in the [100] direction on the SrTiO3(100) substrate and in the [211] direction on the MgO(100) substrate and on the Al2O3 substrate. The Raman scattering spectra show that the thin films grown in the low P-o2 contain lots of oxygen ion vacancies compared to bulk crystals.

paper_title.en: Oxygen permeation in ZrO2-CeO2-CaO for application to oxygen separation from thermally decomposed H2O

description.en: To prepare a high-temperature oxygen permeation membrane, the enhancement of oxygen permeation rate in calucia-stabilized zirconia by CeO2 doping was studied. Two tube-shaped specimens (phi 1.3 x 0.9 cm), 0.5 and 1.5 cm in length, were used to measure the bulk oxygen permeability from a N-2 + O-2 gas mixture into He, eliminating the oxygen permeation caused by the short-circuiting; effect of Pt O-rings which were used to seal the interface of specimens and alumina tubes. Since the oxygen source was N-2 + O-2, mechanical oxygen leakage was estimated from nitrogen leakage into He. From the measurement of oxygen permeations at 1100 similar to 1800 K in [(ZrO2)(1-x)(CeO2)(x)](0.9)(CaO)(0.1) (X = 0.1 similar to 1.0), it was shown that the oxygen permeability, Jr, which was normalized by the temperature and the oxygen partial pressures outside and inside the specimen, and the electronic conductivity which was at 1 atm of oxygen partial pressure and was calculated from Jr, increased exponentially with temperature and X for X = less than or equal to 0.5 while showing saturation tendency for X > 0.5. The oxygen separation membrane of X = 0.4 similar to 0.5 seems reasonable because of the remarkable permeability and lower content of CeO2 which has higher vapor pressure at high temperature.

A conductivity and thermal gravimetric analysis of a Y-doped SrZrO<sub>4</sub> single crystal
Site identification of protons in SrTiO3: Mechanism for large protonic conduction

description.en: It is found that the proton is strongly absorbed in heavily Sc-doped SrTiO3. Neutron-diffraction measurements were performed using single crystals. The O-H distance is found to be about 1.2 Angstrom and the proton concentration is estimated to be about 2 mol% for SrTi0.98Sc0.02O3. Protonic conduction was observed in Sc-doped SrTiO3 by ac-conductivity measurements in wet air, while the hole conductivity was observed in dry air. The proton is bound by the oxygen ion as if the proton makes the hydrogen bond between two oxygen ions, which might be responsible for the high protonic conductivity in this material.

paper_title.en: Fabrication of proton conductor SrCeO3 thin films by excimer laser deposition

description.en: Thin films of a perovskite proton conductor SrCeO3 were fabricated by ArF excimer laser deposition method using bulk SrCeO3 ceramic targets. For incident laser fluences greater than similar to 1 J/cm(2), ablative deposition was observed. SrCeO3 films with predominant growth along the (200) and (121) were deposited on Si and MgO substrates at 600 degrees C. We have found that the oxygen pressure during deposition is the most critical parameter for obtaining oriented films.

paper_title.en: Photoemission spectra of Na beta- and Na beta''-aluminas

description.en: Photoemission spectra of Na beta- and Na beta ''-aluminas have been performed using a beam line with a synchrotron radiation to study the structures of the valence band. Both valence bands of these two materials are constructed by the 2p orbital of oxygen. On the results of this work, ionic conduction mechanism is discussed.
